page.title: 04Mistley Church, Manningtree
page.content: There were three churches dedicated to St.Mary. Mistley Towers was the second one (only the medieval porch remains of the first). It was built in 1735. The nave built between the two towers has been destroyed and the surviving towers are now used as a navagation aid. Because this was pulled down another church was built (1870-71),which has a spire of 140 feet.This is a joint parish church and re-named St.Marys with St.Michaels. The rector, Mr.C.Noyce lives on the Barrat Estate.The church supports many things including a Thursday Club and Youth Club. By Lyndsey Cobb, 12 years old.
